DataElement.preferredName: Head and Neck Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma Pathologic T CPTAC Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary head and neck squamous cell carcinoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Head and Neck Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma Pathologic Primary Tumor
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas._A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: For oncology, area of the body generally construed to comprise base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

Concepts.definition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

Property.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck Pathologic Primary Tumor TNM Finding v8
Property.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor.

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck Pathologic Primary Tumor TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/2/21 jk upd to use C12418 as OC for consistency with NCI Std TNM. 6/20/21 jk upd to use CPTAC specific CUI for property.  4/22/21 jk created for CPTAC HNSCC Baseline CRF - generalized AJCC level.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A national effort to accelerate the understanding of the molecular basis of cancer through the application of large-scale proteome and genome analysis, or proteogenomics._A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics._A national effort to accelerate the understanding of the molecular basis of cancer through the application of large-scale proteome and genome analysis, or proteogenomics._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics._A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm affecting the head and neck.  Representative examples include oral cavity squamous cell carcinoma, laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma, and salivary gland carcinoma._A national effort to accelerate the understanding of the molecular basis of cancer through the application of large-scale proteome and genome analysis, or proteogenomics._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics._A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor._A national effort to accelerate the understanding of the molecular basis of cancer through the application of large-scale proteome and genome analysis, or proteogenomics._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pTis TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pTis TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with a finding of carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pTis TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with a finding of carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pTX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pTX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck in which the primary tumor cannot be identified. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pTX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck in which the primary tumor cannot be identified. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT4b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT4b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with skull base invasion and/or skull base foramen involvement.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT4b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with skull base invasion and/or skull base foramen involvement.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT4a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT4a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with gross cortical bone/marrow invasion.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT4a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with gross cortical bone/marrow invasion.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT4 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT4 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with gross cortical bone/marrow, skull base invasion and/or skull base foramen invasion.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT4 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with gross cortical bone/marrow, skull base invasion and/or skull base foramen invasion.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with tumor 4 cm or larger in greatest dimension or minor bone erosion or perineural invasion or deep invasion. Deep invasion is defined as invasion beyond the subcutaneous fat or larger than 6 mm; perineural invasion for T3 classification is defined as tumor cells within the nerve sheath of a nerve lying deeper than the dermis or measuring 0.1 mm or larger in caliber, or presenting with clinical or radiographic involvement of named nerves without skull base invasion or transgression.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with tumor 4 cm or larger in greatest dimension or minor bone erosion or perineural invasion or deep invasion. Deep invasion is defined as invasion beyond the subcutaneous fat or larger than 6 mm; perineural invasion for T3 classification is defined as tumor cells within the nerve sheath of a nerve lying deeper than the dermis or measuring 0.1 mm or larger in caliber, or presenting with clinical or radiographic involvement of named nerves without skull base invasion or transgression.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with tumor 2 cm or larger, but smaller than 4 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with tumor 2 cm or larger, but smaller than 4 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with tumor smaller than 2 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pT1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with tumor smaller than 2 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No morphologic evidence of primary tumor, in accordance with TNM classification system guidelines.

Concepts.definition: No morphologic evidence of primary tumor, in accordance with TNM classification system guidelines.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A pathologic primary tumor TNM stage finding.  The definition of pT1a stage finding depends on the particular type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for breast cancer, pT1a stage finding is defined as follows: cancer with tumor size more than 0.1 cm, but not more than 0.5 cm in greatest dimension; for lung cancer, pT1a stage finding is defined as follows: cancer with a tumor size of 2 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus). The uncommon superficial tumor of any size with its invasive component limited to the bronchial wall, which may extend proximal to the main bronchus, is also classified as T1a. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: A pathologic primary tumor TNM finding.  The definition of pT1a finding depends on the particular type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for breast cancer, pT1a finding is defined as follows: cancer with tumor size more than 0.1 cm, but not more than 0.5 cm in greatest dimension; for lung cancer, pT1a finding is defined as follows: cancer with a tumor size of 2 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus). The uncommon superficial tumor of any size with its invasive component limited to the bronchial wall, which may extend proximal to the main bronchus, is also classified as T1a. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A pathologic primary tumor TNM stage finding.  The definition of pT1b stage finding depends on the particular type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for breast cancer, pT1b stage finding is defined as follows: cancer with tumor size more than 0.5 cm, but not more than 1.0 cm in greatest dimension; for lung cancer, pT1b stage finding is defined as follows: cancer with a tumor size more than 2 cm but 3 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: A pathologic primary tumor TNM finding. The definition of pT1b finding depends on the particular type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for breast cancer, pT1b finding is defined as follows: cancer with tumor size more than 0.5 cm, but not more than 1.0 cm in greatest dimension; for lung cancer, pT1b finding is defined as follows: cancer with a tumor size more than 2 cm but 3 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)
